extendedInfo.description: Piano note reading game. 50 levels of piano note reading challenges20 piano Achievements 5 piano chapters Each piano level progresses harder. First chapter is a piano tutorial chapter targeting users who have no prior knowledge on reading piano musical sheets. Second chapter is for users with minimal experience in piano musical sheet note reading. Third level and the rest is where the piano action begins. Final Chapter is for Chopin incarnate piano musical note readers with fast lightning eye to finger reflex. This App will help you sharpen your piano musical note reading agility while pushing you to the edge of your seat. This App will engage your visual senses, polish your timing, increase your patience, bite your lip, hold your breath while  sharpening your piano note reading skills. If there is a genre for piano Musical-Cliffhanger games, this might be it. but then again may-be it's just the developer. If you find time to comment and rate the game, that will be very much appreciated.Keywords: learn, keyboard, concert, grand, pianoforte, guitar, dance, hero, revolution, rhythm, game, angel, teacher, relaxing, chords, notes, lessons,Steampunk------------------------for questions regarding metronome beat not is synch. The answer is, there are eight notes in between the regular metronome beat.  These are called attack waves.

reviews.title: Losing stars RAPIDLY
reviews.comment: the metronome is random and notes never hit on a beat. could you please put it in time instead of trying to explain it away? How about options to disable applause and that splash screen which was clever once but TEDIOUS every time we minimize or hit the back button accidentally.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great game!  Best way to learn.
reviews.comment: This is a great way to learn notation!  The games get challenging quickly, but taken in small doses it really helps learn.
reviews.author: Daniel Steen

reviews.title: Awesome  you should play this
reviews.comment: The other piano note reading apps were boring.  This one is exciting. A little more user control of speed, note range and hit zone width would help.
reviews.author: Ken Morison

reviews.title: Has Potential , Needs Work
reviews.comment: This game would be fun if it weren\'t so frustrating. The keys are too small for the average adults\'fingers. This song songs aren\'t  recognizable and therefore, hard to follow. Also, there are words appearing on the screen blocking the notes making it hard to see them, causing you to s*** the room key if any at all. Overall, the concept is good but the execution needs work.
reviews.author: Trich Ware

reviews.title: Works perfect
reviews.comment: Its a fun way to learn notation.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: This game has the great potential, while dev stop developing it?
reviews.author: Vorapoap Lohwongwatana

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: The hard mode can be frustrating at times but I am now learning. Thanks.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: The best app I\'ve found for learning to sight-read for piano. Lots of fun.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Update it by the way!
reviews.comment: Add options to set all lines in the staff the same width AS IN REAL LIFE and to scroll the notes the opposite direction as any musician is supposed to read them! No updates since summer 2012!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: amazing!
reviews.comment: Good chance to play and learn at the same time! And it would be even better if there will be an option to disable applause,  it disturbs people around, but I cannot lower sound in order to hear metronome.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great.
reviews.comment: Great tool for learning notes. I have 3 children who all like to play so it would be nice to be able to play as different users.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Great app, its an easy and funny way to learn to read sheet music.
reviews.author: A Google User
